}} 'Extras' is a young adult science fiction novel written by Scott Westerfeld.
The novel was published and released by Simon & Schuster on October 2, 2007, and
is a companion book to the ''Uglies'' series. However, Extras differs from its
predecessors in that its protagonist is fifteen-year-old Aya Fuse, not earlier
protagonist Tally Youngblood. Despite the fact that Youngblood is not the main
character, she still appears in the book's later chapters in a major role. The
book was received well by critics such as the [[New York Times]]'s James Hynes.
